com.noctarius.tengi.spi.buffer

Interface ReadableMemoryBuffer

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    MemoryBuffer

    public interface ReadableMemoryBuffer
    The ReadableMemoryBuffer interface describes a buffer which contains a content-stream to be read. Only basic data types can be retrieved from this buffer. For more complex types, additional helpers need to be used to read multi-byte types or values from the stream.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • readable

        boolean readable()

        Returns true if the buffer is readable, otherwise false. Returning true means that the current readerIndex() value is smaller than the internal content size.

        If this method returns true, than the returned value of readableBytes() must be greater than 0.

        Returns:
        returns true if more bytes are available to read, otherwise false

      • readableBytes

        int readableBytes()

        Returns the number of upcoming bytes to be read. This value represents the number of bytes between the current readerIndex() and the size of the stored content-stream.

        If this method returns a value greater than 0, than the returned value of readable() must be true.

        Returns:
        returns the number of readable (upcoming) bytes

      • readBytes

        void readBytes(byte[] bytes)

        Transfers the content of a byte-array from the underlying byte-stream buffer. The byte-array is read as a whole from begin to the end.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to read all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        bytes - the byte-array to transfer the content to
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to read all elements

      • readBytes

        void readBytes(byte[] bytes,
               int offset,
               int length)

        Transfers the content of a byte-array from the underlying byte-stream buffer. The byte-array is read as a whole beginning from the given offset and will be filled with as many bytes as defined by the given length.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to read all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        bytes - the byte-array to transfer the content to
        offset - the offset to begin to write to
        length - the number of bytes to write
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to read all elements

      • readBuffer

        void readBuffer(ByteBuffer byteBuffer)

        Transfers the content of a ByteBuffer from the underlying byte-stream buffer. The ByteBuffer is read as a whole from current position to the end.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to read all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        byteBuffer - the ByteBuffer to transfer the content to
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to read all elements

      • readBuffer

        void readBuffer(ByteBuffer byteBuffer,
                int offset,
                int length)

        Transfers the content of a ByteBuffer from the underlying byte-stream buffer. The ByteBuffer is read as a whole beginning from the given offset and will be filled with as many bytes as defined by the given length.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to read all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        byteBuffer - the ByteBuffer to transfer the content to
        offset - the offset to begin to write to
        length - the number of bytes to write
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to read all elements

      • readBuffer

        void readBuffer(MemoryBuffer memoryBuffer)

        Transfers the content of a MemoryBuffer from the underlying byte-stream buffer. The MemoryBuffer is read as a whole from the current writerIndex to the end.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to read all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        memoryBuffer - the MemoryBuffer to transfer the content to
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to read all elements

      • readBuffer

        void readBuffer(MemoryBuffer memoryBuffer,
                int offset,
                int length)

        Transfers the content of a MemoryBuffer from the underlying byte-stream buffer. The ByteBuffer is read as a whole beginning from the given offset and will be filled with as many bytes as defined by the given length.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to read all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        memoryBuffer - the MemoryBuffer to transfer the content to
        offset - the offset to begin to write to
        length - the number of bytes to write
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to read all elements

      • readByte

        byte readByte()

        Reads the content of a byte from the underlying byte-stream buffer.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to read all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        Returns:
        the byte value read from the buffer
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to read all elements

      • readerIndex

        int readerIndex()
        Returns the current read index position inside the buffer.
        Returns:
        the current read index position

      • readerIndex

        void readerIndex(int readerIndex)
        Sets the read index position inside the buffer to the given value.
        Parameters:
        readerIndex - the new read index position to be set
